verses.verse: And Zophar the Naamathite answered and said:
So my thoughts cause me to answer, even because of my haste in me.
I have heard the chastening of my reproach; and the spirit from my understanding makes me reply.
Do you know this from of old, from the setting of man on earth,
that the exulting of the wicked ones is near an end, and the joy of the godless one is for a moment?
Though his height goes up to the heavens, and his head touches to the clouds,
he shall perish forever like his dung; they who see him shall say, Where is he?
He flies off like a dream, and is not found; and is driven away like a night vision.
An eye caught sight of him, but will not again; yea, his place shall not again see him.
His sons seek the favors of the poor ones, and his hands shall give back his wealth.
His bones are full of his youthful vigor, but it lies down on the dust with him.
Even if evil is sweet in his mouth, and he hides it under his tongue,
he spares it, and he will not leave it; yea, he keeps holding it back in his mouth;
yet his food in his belly shall be turned; the gall of asps is within him.
He swallows wealth, but vomits it; God drives it out from his belly.
He shall suck the poison of asps; the viper's tongue shall slay him.
He shall not see the rivers, the flowings of torrents of honey and curd
giving back his gain, and he will not swallow the wealth of his exchanges; he will not enjoy it.
For he crushed and forsook the poor ones; he stole a house, but he had not built it.
Surely he shall not know ease in his belly; he will not escape with his things of desire.
There is no remnant for his food; because of this, his good will not last.
In the fullness of his scorn, it was distress for him; the hand of every wretched one shall come upon him.
It shall happen at the filling of his belly, He shall cast on him the fury of His wrath, and He shall rain on him while he is eating.
He may flee from the iron weapon, a bow of bronze shall pierce him.
One draws it, and draws it from his back, even lightning from his gall; terrors come upon him.
All darkness is hidden for secret treasuring; a fire not blown shall consume him; those left in his tent shall tremble.
The heavens shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall be raising up itself against him.
The fruit of his house shall move, flowing away in the day of His wrath.
This is the portion of the evil man from God, and the inheritance of his word from God.
